intro: Acinodendron multinervulosum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Olacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive milky sap, which is toxic and used in traditional medicine. The plant features compound leaves with multiple veins, and its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique properties, it has both ornamental and medicinal significance in its native habitat.
